intro: [WRONG START] COLDENIA PURPUSSII, commonly known as the New Zealand native plant, is a shrub native to the forests of New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by insects. Coldenia purpusii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
